intro: Leucadendron strictum, commonly known as the silver tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, cone-like inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. It is a hardy shrub or small tree that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
